The opposite-colored bishops endgame is a chess endgame in which each side 
has a single bishop, but the bishops reside on opposite-colored squares on the 
chessboard, thus cannot attack or block each other. Without other pieces (but 
with pawns) these endings are notorious for their ... Positions when one side has 
an extra pawn are usually drawn and even two...
